intro: Arundo varia var. acutiflora, commonly known as the acute-flowered reed, is a perennial grass native to southern Africa. It features tall, slender stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens and wetland habitats.
